2000.context: Teradata Corporation is a cloud analytics and data platform company focused on enterprise data warehousing and analytics. Data warehouse leader for large enterprises.

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Enterprise database with data warehousing capabilities

competitors.name: IBM DB2
competitors.notes: Enterprise database and data warehousing

competitors.name: Informix
competitors.notes: Relational database, acquired by IBM 2001

competitors.name: Red Brick
competitors.notes: Data warehouse database, acquired by Informix

competitors.name: NCR
competitors.notes: Parent company of Teradata division

2005.context: Teradata Corporation is a cloud analytics and data platform company focused on enterprise data warehousing and analytics. Enterprise analytics and BI integration.

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Major competitor offering Oracle Database and data warehousing solutions for enterprise analytics and business intelligence

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Significant competitor with DB2 database and data warehousing solutions, along with business intelligence tools

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Competitor with SQL Server database and growing presence in enterprise data warehousing and BI markets

competitors.name: Netezza
competitors.notes: Specialized data warehousing appliance competitor offering high-performance analytics platform (later acquired by IBM in 2010)

competitors.name: Greenplum
competitors.notes: Emerging MPP database competitor for data warehousing and analytics (later acquired by EMC in 2010, now part of VMware)

competitors.name: Vertica
competitors.notes: Column-store database competitor for analytics and data warehousing (founded in 2005, later acquired by HP in 2011)

2010.context: Teradata Corporation is a cloud analytics and data platform company focused on enterprise data warehousing and analytics. Big data and Hadoop integration.

competitors.name: Oracle Exadata
competitors.notes: Database machine for data warehousing and OLTP

competitors.name: IBM Netezza
competitors.notes: Data warehouse appliance, acquired by IBM 2010

competitors.name: Greenplum
competitors.notes: Massively parallel data warehouse, acquired by EMC 2010

competitors.name: Microsoft SQL Server
competitors.notes: Enterprise database with analytics

competitors.name: SAP Business Objects
competitors.notes: Business intelligence and data warehousing

2015.context: Teradata Corporation is a cloud analytics and data platform company focused on enterprise data warehousing and analytics. Cloud hybrid strategy development.

competitors.name: Oracle Exadata
competitors.notes: Engineered system for data warehouse and OLTP

competitors.name: IBM Netezza
competitors.notes: Data warehouse appliance

competitors.name: SAP HANA
competitors.notes: In-memory database platform

competitors.name: Amazon Redshift
competitors.notes: Emerging cloud data warehouse

competitors.name: Microsoft SQL Server
competitors.notes: Enterprise database with data warehouse capabilities

2020.context: Teradata Corporation is a cloud analytics and data platform company focused on enterprise data warehousing and analytics. VantageCloud platform. Consumption pricing.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.notes: Cloud-native data warehouse, IPO'd September 2020 at $33B valuation

competitors.name: Amazon Redshift
competitors.notes: AWS cloud data warehouse service

competitors.name: Google BigQuery
competitors.notes: Serverless cloud data warehouse

competitors.name: Microsoft Azure Synapse
competitors.notes: Integrated analytics service

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Autonomous Data Warehouse and traditional database

2024.context: Teradata Corporation is a cloud analytics and data platform company focused on enterprise data warehousing and analytics. AI/ML analytics. Cloud migration acceleration.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.notes: Cloud-native data warehouse platform, major competitor in modern data cloud space

competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.notes: Unified analytics platform with lakehouse architecture, combining data lakes and warehouses

competitors.name: Google BigQuery
competitors.notes: Fully-managed serverless data warehouse from Google Cloud

competitors.name: Amazon Redshift
competitors.notes: AWS cloud data warehouse service, major cloud competitor

competitors.name: Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics
competitors.notes: Microsoft's integrated analytics service combining data warehousing and big data

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Traditional enterprise database and analytics competitor, Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse

competitors.name: IBM Db2 Warehouse
competitors.notes: Enterprise data warehouse solution on-premises and cloud

competitors.name: SAP HANA
competitors.notes: In-memory database and analytics platform

competitors.name: Cloudera
competitors.notes: Enterprise data cloud platform for hybrid and multi-cloud

competitors.name: Vertica
competitors.notes: Analytics data warehouse, now part of OpenText

2025.context: Teradata Corporation is a cloud analytics and data platform company focused on enterprise data warehousing and analytics. Cloud analytics platform. Competing with Snowflake, Databricks.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.notes: Primary cloud-native competitor in enterprise data warehousing, offering multi-cloud platform focused on unifying data and AI-powered analytics. Direct competitor in the same data warehousing and analytics landscape

competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.notes: Top alternative and major competitive threat currently raising $10B at $62B valuation. Databricks Data Intelligence Platform is the leading Teradata Vantage alternative, risking customer acquisition during Teradata's cloud migration cycles

competitors.name: Microsoft SQL Server
competitors.notes: Major database and analytics competitor, one of the top three Teradata Vantage alternatives, leveraging Microsoft's enterprise relationships and Azure cloud infrastructure

competitors.name: Google Cloud BigQuery
competitors.notes: Cloud-native data warehouse competitor from Google, offering serverless analytics and integration with Google Cloud ecosystem

competitors.name: SAP HANA Cloud
competitors.notes: Enterprise competitor in cloud database management and in-memory analytics, with SAP being listed as one of Teradata's primary competitors alongside strong ERP market position

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Primary legacy competitor in enterprise data warehousing and analytics, competing with similar hybrid cloud approaches and enterprise customer base

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Major enterprise database and analytics competitor, one of Teradata's primary competitors with strong presence in on-premises and cloud data warehousing

competitors.name: Starburst
competitors.notes: Emerging competitor in distributed query engines and data lake analytics, offering modern alternative to traditional data warehousing approaches

mentionedBy.name: Snowflake Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Enterprise data warehouse solution transitioning to cloud

mentionedBy.name: Snowflake Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Enterprise data warehouse with cloud offerings

mentionedBy.name: Snowflake Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Enterprise data warehouse and analytics platform with deep analytics capabilities
